intro: Seemannia nematanthodes, commonly known as the narrow-flowered seemannia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, and it thrives in moist, tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
